result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan C Whitman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on 10/25/2016

miscConds.notes: $500.00 cash bond to be applied towards $525 buy money owed and remaining buy money of $25.00 to be paid within 60 days. If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. Must submit DNA sample and and the surcharge.   Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must submit sample immediately.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 103 days credit to be applied towards conditional jail sentence.

103 days jail with 103 days credit.
